thread.title: Huckabee: Trump Criticized After Proving Critics Wrong With Comment On Putin
thread.title_full: Huckabee: Trump Criticized After Proving Critics Wrong With Comment On Putin

author: Jack Davis
title: Huckabee: Trump Criticized After Proving Critics Wrong With Comment On Putin
text:
Huckabee: Trump Criticized After Proving Critics Wrong With Comment On Putin "... now he gets in trouble for that ..." by Jack Davis February 6, 2017 at 3:04pm Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
Former Arkansas Gov. Mike Huckabee noted Monday that President Donald Trump is now being criticized after having proved his critics wrong. 
Huckabee waded into the controversy that erupted after Trump sidestepped the chance to condemn Russian leader Vladimir Putin during an interview with Bill O’Reilly of Fox News that aired Sunday. 
“ Putin’s a killer ,” O’Reilly said during the interview. Advertisement - story continues below 
“There are a lot of killers. We’ve got a lot of killers. What do you think — our country’s so innocent. You think our country’s so innocent?” Trump said in response. 
He added, “A lot of killers around, believe me.” 
Those comments were interpreted as Trump’s support for Putin. Advertisement - story continues below . @SenSchumer calls on Republicans to denounce Trump's Putin comments: "You know if a Democrat said it you'd be just howling at the moon." pic.twitter.com/hiP5btnv1Q 
— ABC News Politics (@ABCPolitics) February 6, 2017 When has a Democratic political activists been poisoned by the GOP, or vice versa? We are not the same as #Putin . MR 
— Marco Rubio (@marcorubio) February 5, 2017 Kasich slams Trump: United States not equivalent to Putin https://t.co/LVNqXCIvd6 pic.twitter.com/wJzFtMdqqs 
— The Hill (@thehill) February 5, 2017 
“I can speak for myself, and I already have about Vladimir Putin and the way the Russians operate. I’m not going to critique every utterance of the president. I obviously don’t see the issue the same way he does,” said Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell, R-Ky. Advertisement - story continues below Democrat Labels Trump A ‘Dictator’ For Wanting Cabinet Nominees Confirmed 
But Huckabee, appearing on the Fox News program America’s Newsroom, said Trump’s critics want it both ways. 
“So many critics of Donald Trump have said he’s unfiltered and he’s going to get us into all kinds of disputes with foreign governments because he’s too blunt,” Huckabee said. 
But when Trump was diplomatic, as he was in the O’Reilly interview, he is still criticized, Huckabee noted. 
“So Donald Trump is acting more statesman-like in saying, ‘Look, I’m not going to call another foreign leader a murderer or a thug on international television because that kind of makes it hard to work with him,'” Huckabee said. 
“So he doesn’t do it and instead of the press saying, ‘Yes, he’s acting more presidential now rather than just firing off,’ now he gets in trouble for that,” Huckabee said. 
He said the fact of the matter is that the outspoken president will always ruffle some feathers but largely speaks for mainstream America. 
“He is like the New Testament character of Nathanael, in whom there is no guile. No pretense , no phoniness. What you see is what you get,” Huckabee said. 
“Whatever Donald Trump says as president, somebody is not going to like it, but a lot of American people do,” he added. What do you think? Scroll down to comment below. Advertisement Popular Right Now
